Thank you to @TheTaskForce for being a partner to me in this effort!

As #Pride2019 comes to a close, let us work to take the next step forward in the march for fairness, freedom and full equality for every LGBTQ American.

Let’s pass the #EqualityAct in the Senate. pic.twitter.com/XubUr3xInL

I’m standing with @VictoryInst on the anniversary of #Stonewall50 because we cannot mistake progress for victory. 

We have to keep fighting to pass the #EqualityAct so that all LGBTQ Americans can finally have the freedom of full equality. pic.twitter.com/SPGKKp8OL4

Trump fails to lead and continues to take us in the wrong direction on confronting the #ClimateCrisis and threat it poses to our economy, national security & public health.

The longer we fail to act, the more costly climate change will be. #ClimateCosts https://www.politico.eu/article/trump-pressures-other-g20-leaders-to-weaken-climate-goals/ …

Today, we must stand together as our brothers and sisters did 50 years ago, on the right side of history. 

Let us work to take the next step forward in the march for fairness, freedom, and full equality for every LGBTQ American. #Stonewall50 #Pride2019 https://www.thenation.com/article/stonewall-equality-act-discrimination/ …

My resolution honoring #Stonewall50 passed the Senate! I’m so proud of how far we’ve come since that night 50 yrs ago, when brave Americans stood up against inequality.
 
Let’s remember their courage & work to pass on to the next generation a country that is more equal, not less. pic.twitter.com/MhkGyFIx5E

Tomorrow we will have a vote on @SenatorTomUdall's bipartisan amendment to require the Trump administration to get authorization from Congress before beginning any military engagements with Iran. 

I will vote for it to prevent an unauthorized war with Iran.

Our Democracy works for the people when voters choose their elected representatives, not when politicians pick their voters with hyper-partisan #gerrymandering. Today SCOTUS failed to protect the constitutional right of every citizen to participate in choosing who works for them.
